t: Psalm 50
A psalm of Asaph.
The*pn Mighty One, God, the Lord,*s speaks*ld and summons the earth from*ld the rising of the sun to where it sets.
From*ln Zion, perfect in beauty, God*ld shines forth.
Our*ln God comes and*ld will not be silent; a*ln fire devours before him, and*ld around him a tempest rages.
He*ln summons the heavens above, and*ld the earth, that he may judge his people:
“Gather*ln to me this consecrated people, who*ld made a covenant with me by sacrifice.”
And*ln the heavens proclaim his righteousness, for*ld he is a God of justice.
“Listen,*pn my people, and I will speak; I*ld will testify against you, Israel: I*ld am God, your God.
I*ln bring no charges against you concerning your sacrifices or*ld concerning your burnt offerings, which are ever before me.
I*ln have no need of a bull from your stall or*ld of goats from your pens,
for*ln every animal of the forest is mine, and*ld the cattle on a thousand hills.
I*ln know every bird in the mountains, and*ld the insects in the fields are mine.
If*ln I were hungry I would not tell you, for*ld the world is mine, and all that is in it.
Do*ln I eat the flesh of bulls or*ld drink the blood of goats?
“Sacrifice*pn thank offerings to God, fulfill*ld your vows to the Most High,
and*ln call on me in the day of trouble; I*ld will deliver you, and you will honor me.”
But*p to the wicked person, God says: “What*pn right have you to recite my laws or*ld take my covenant on your lips?
You*ln hate my instruction and*ld cast my words behind you.
When*ln you see a thief, you join with him; you*ld throw in your lot with adulterers.
You*ln use your mouth for evil and*ld harness your tongue to deceit.
You*ln sit and testify against your brother and*ld slander your own mother’s son.
When*ln you did these things and I kept silent, you*ld thought I was exactly like you. But*ln I now arraign you and*ld set my accusations before you.
“Consider*pn this, you who forget God, or*ld I will tear you to pieces, with no one to rescue you:
Those*ln who sacrifice thank offerings honor me, and*ld to the blameless I will show my salvation.”
